pokedexEntries.red: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedexEntries.blue: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedexEntries.yellow: Famous for being very unreliable. It can be found swimming in seas, lakes, rivers and shallow puddles.
pokedexEntries.gold: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions, but never more than seven feet.
pokedexEntries.silver: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like Pidgeotto to catch it mid-jump.
pokedexEntries.crystal: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.
pokedexEntries.ruby: Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.
pokedexEntries.sapphire: Magikarp is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash around. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However, it is actually a very hardy Pokémon that can survive in any body of water no matter how polluted it is.
pokedexEntries.emerald: Its swimming muscles are weak, so it is easily washed away by currents. In places where water pools, you can see many Magikarp deposited there by the flow.
pokedexEntries.fireRed: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
pokedexEntries.leafGreen: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedexEntries.diamond: It is said to be the world's weakest Pokémon. No one knows why it has managed to survive.
pokedexEntries.pearl: It is unable to swim against even slow-moving currents. It always splashes about for some reason.
pokedexEntries.platinum: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
pokedexEntries.heartGold: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions, but never more than seven feet.
pokedexEntries.soulSilver: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like Pidgeotto to catch it mid-jump.
pokedexEntries.black: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
pokedexEntries.white: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
pokedexEntries.black2: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
pokedexEntries.white2: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
pokedexEntries.x: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
pokedexEntries.y: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedexEntries.omegaRuby: Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.
pokedexEntries.alphaSapphire: Magikarp is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash around. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However, it is actually a very hardy Pokémon that can survive in any body of water no matter how polluted it is.
pokedexEntries.sun: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you'll soon grow tired of seeing them.
pokedexEntries.moon: Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for predators. On the bright side, many Pokémon enjoy longer life spans, thanks to Magikarp.
pokedexEntries.ultraSun: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but they have become gradually weaker over time.
pokedexEntries.ultraMoon: Thanks to their strong hold on life, dirty water doesn’t bother them at all. They live in waters all over the world!
